conclusion: Use Snell's Law and trigonometry to find the length of PM.
Identify given values: angle of incidence 37°, refractive index 4/3, rectangle length 2L, width L.
Apply Snell's Law to find sin(θr) = 0.6 and θr ≈ 36.87°.
Determine angle with horizontal side AB: 53.13°.
Use trigonometry to find PM = L / tan(53.13°) ≈ 0.75L.
